Title: Global Shared Services Employee Resource Manager
RoleDescription:
Wayfair's Employee Resource Center (ERC) serves as a vital hub, dedicated to supporting employees, enhancing productivity, and fostering an environment of inclusion, collaboration, innovation, and professional growth. The ERC is currently seeking an experienced Employee Resource Manager to lead and develop assigned teams while ensuring the efficient delivery of services aligned with Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
In this role, you will oversee task distribution, prioritize initiatives, and collaborate with Talent leadership to continuously improve the quality, compliance, and efficiency of ERC processes. Success in this position requires a deep understanding of employee lifecycle processessuch as hiring, terminations, benefits, and leaves of absenceas well as expertise in federal, state, and local employment laws. This knowledge will empower you to effectively support your team and handle escalations with confidence.
The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong critical thinking, analytical skills, and the ability to influence and collaborate with senior leaders to drive organizational success.
What You'll Do

Support, develop and lead a team of ERC Associates and Senior Associates who are responsible for handling talent-related inquiries of moderate complexity. 
Deliver on OKRs/ KPIs and ensure adherence to Service Level Agreements.
Monitor and analyze volume to identify and communicate trends and assist in capacity planning.
Coach, mentor, and assist in developing the team, including monitoring, reporting, and driving individual and team performance.
Establish and maintain relationships with Talent Partners and stakeholders to seek feedback and identify opportunities.
Ensure third party vendors perform according to Service Level Agreements (e.g. Equifax, MetLife).
Ensure compliance with Company  policies and procedures as well as state, federal and local laws.
Drive the ERC shared service vision through continued focus on efficiency and standardization with an emphasis on repeatable, scalable processes.

What You'll Need

3-5 years in a Managerial role with 3+ years of Human Resources Management experience (HRBP, HR Shared Services).
Bachelors degree in Human Resources Management, or related field, or equivalent experience.
Strong critical thinking skills with the ability to anticipate second order impacts and offer proactive solutions in advance even when beyond their immediate area of responsibility if necessary.
Able to deliver both direct results and results through their teams (e.g., developing their direct reports).
Able to partner with and/or deliver outcomes to stakeholders on trends, issues, process improvement as well as escalation resolution and cross collaboration on projects.  
Strong project management skills (PMP a plus) and demonstrated success in executing complete end to end projects.
Experienced in manipulating, analyzing and reporting data while knowing when/how to tailor to specific audiences.

Title: Senior Technical Analyst, Operations Analytics
RoleDescription:
Must be onsite in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)
We are looking for advanced analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individuals who can translate business problems into data-driven solutions and actionable insights to influence operational results. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story.
You will join the Operations Analytics team focused on steering Wayfairs long-term strategic operations outlook. The Operations Analytics team supports long-term, high-scope, high-complexity strategic planning and business case questions within the operations organization. We work closely across Operations Research, Network Management, Transportation & Delivery and other operations teams to ensure continuity between their near and medium-term planning objective functions with our future state strategic outlooks.
What Youll Do:

Work within a small but high-impact team focused on providing analytical firepower to several groups under the operations umbrella, with a focus on Fulfillment, Planning, and Analytics. 
Support the strategic outlook and review pipeline for our global fulfillment and home delivery network, steering decisions to grow, reshape, and optimize our network footprint and within the 4 walls operations. 
Run the end-to-end analytics to recommendation pipeline, designing and building models that glean data insights, packaging insights into concise and actionable recommendations, and selling the data story to our cross functional and senior stakeholders. 
Utilize your experience in SQL, python, and spreadsheet modelling to build tailored and robust sensitivity analyses that unlock core business insights. Develop tools and dashboards that provide critical insights, enabling data-driven decision-making.
Support work across teams ranging from Network Management, Operations Research, Transportation and Delivery, Real Estate, Customer Service, and more. Contribute to projects that span various operational domains, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
Work in a fast paced, highly iterative environment that is responsive to the evolving needs of our operations functions and strategies. 

What Youll Need:

Bachelors or Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research, or a related discipline with a strong academic record. 
Experience in an analytics or data science role, performing quantitative analysis and delivering actionable recommendations from findings.
Ability to synthesize insights from undefined and open ended problem sets and articulate into clear, top down evidence backed narratives. Present complex information in a concise and understandable manner.
Advanced proficiency in SQL, including knowledge of aggregate functions, joins, etc.
Hands-on experience and comfortability with python for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience building comprehensive slide decks and white papers.
Solution-oriented & curious intellectual mindset and curiosity, with a passion for continuous learning and problem-solving.
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously, ensuring timely and accurate deliverables.
Strategic thinker, able to provide direction and support to the team in setting clear project goals, managing the execution of projects that align with business objectives.
Experience with or knowledge of supply chain and logistics concepts is a strong plus.

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy: All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

Title: Health & Safety Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Location: Lutterworth or Remote UK with travel 
Contract: 12 month fixed term contract
Hours: 40 hour per week, Monday to Friday
Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership,  Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days starting Holiday (with tenure entitlement) + Bank Holidays,  Pension, Cycle to Work scheme amongst others.
We are seeking an experienced and driven Health & Safety Supervisor to manage our safety and security initiatives across our UK & Ireland Home Delivery Network! 
With responsibility for five sites, the Health & Safety Supervisor plays a crucial role in providing advice and guidance to all of our sites, ensuring that our commitment to providing a safe and secure environment for all of our employees and partners is adhered to. 
You'll also provide strong H&S leadership, working in a consultative and highly collaborative manner with stakeholders to truly embed strong safety practices into all aspects of our operations. 
What you will do: 
Partnering with our Global Safety & Security Business Support and Compliance teams you'll support operations across our five UK sites in executing our global safety vision by anticipating, identifying and evaluating hazards to build in robust safety practices. This includes implementing our Injury and Illness Prevention Plan and our Safety & Security Accountability programs. 
Working closely with your sites, you will foster a culture of Safety First consciousness by collaborating with all levels of site management to mitigate risks, resolve safety and security issues and manage H&S cases and investigations on an ongoing basis. You'll advise on best practices, standardising processes where needed and escalating any requests for change where necessary to the Safety Compliance Team. Wayfair have a culture of implementing continuous improvement, and part of this role is also to develop robust action plans to improve safety and security culture, raising awareness and promoting engagement. 
In addition you will manage any administration required such as preparing and submitting incident reports in compliance with company requirements. We also utilise a third party guard service which you will provide daily guidance for, ensuring there are no gaps in coverage. 
What you will need: 

Demonstrable experience in a dedicated Safety and/or Security role, NEBOSH or IOSH Certification is preferable but not required. 
Proficient knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements that govern worker Health & Safety, physical assessment and ergonomic skills with experience of H&S case management. Demonstrable working knowledge of safety and security concepts, best practices, policies, programs and procedures.
Have the ability to handle multiple projects and caseloads. 
Strong analytical skills with the ability to manage large data sets, build insights and implement action plans

This is a UK wide role and involves travel when required. 
If you are a collaborative and driven Health & Safety professional with experience of overseeing several sites looking for your next challenge click apply today and speak with one of our recruiters today to find out how your journey can start.

Title: Software Engineer II, DMLP
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
What You'll Do:

Take complex engineering problems, design appropriate solutions and deliver on them.
Work on a variety of technologies - from system implementations, to software and tools built in house, to application systems delivering acceleration as a service. 
Implement robust, well-tested services. Provide technical design and code reviews for peers within your team.
Provide insights into opportunity areas for the platform, influencing priorities and team roadmaps in close partnership with Engineering and Product leadership.

What youll Need:

3+ years of experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
Experience in development of new applications using technologies such as Java, Python andSQL
Experience with Cloud Native architecture in one of the big 3 providers (GCP, Azure, AWS).
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch,etc.).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders alike.
Proficient in effective troubleshooting and issue resolution techniques.

We are thrilled to welcome a creative and data-driven Campaign & Content Strategist to our team. In this vital role, you will design and execute integrated marketing campaigns while crafting compelling content strategies that amplify Wayfairs global vision and resonate with UK & Irish audiences. The EU Marketing Team drives initiatives across Performance Marketing, Onsite Marketing, CRM & Email, Social Media, Brand & Content Strategy, and Promotional Planning. We develop data-driven strategies to enhance engagement, boost conversion, and accelerate Wayfairs growth across European markets.

RoleDescription:
About the Role: 
We are seeking a strategic and results-driven Analyst for our Profit Management and Pricing team for Wayfair UK and Ireland. This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business in the region by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies. Based in our London office, you will work on a five-member team, collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive optimal financial performance.
 
What Youll Do: As a Pricing and Profitability Analyst at Wayfair, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to shape strategies that deliver value to our customers and strengthen supplier partnerships. Your responsibilities will involve diving into data, identifying key trends, and using your insights to support decision-making across various areas of the business. Specific duties include:

Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the UK and Ireland markets.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive branded pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Pricing and Promotions Exection

Update prices on site as our margin strategies evolve, cost models change or in support of promotions.
Simulate expected price changes and QA actuals to ensure accuracy. 

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Business Performance Monitoring and Problem Solving:

Tackle ambiguous challenges by leveraging your analytical skills to generate actionable solutions that deliver measurable improvements in profitability, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency.
Work with large datasets to identify trends, perform analyses, and develop reports to drive business decisions across different Commercial functions.
Use advanced analytical tools and techniques (Excel, SQL, R, Python) to build data-driven insights and recommend improvements.
Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Work closely with Finance, Marketing, and Supplier Partnerships teams to align pricing strategies with broader business goals.
Partner with engineering and analytics teams to enhance pricing tools and systems for improved efficiency and accuracy.


What Were Looking For

Educational Background:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant discipline (eg. business, analytics, statistics, economics) 


Exceptional Analytical and Quantitative Skills: 

Excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings 


Technical Skills:

Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Google BigQuery, Excel) and motivated to learn and develop further. Experience with pricing or financial modeling tools is desirable.


Strong business acumen: 

Ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective 


Exceptional problem-solving and execution skills

Ability to make decisions, reprioritize tasks, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity 


Stakeholder Management:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with ability to work across diverse teams and levels of an organization.

Responsible for the development and maintenance of all process materials, which include training materials for the Network (Quality, Returns, and Value-Added-Services). 
Creation of all documentation (SOPs) for core global returns and incident team processes (Jobs-Aides, Job Instructions, SOPs, Project Plans)

Communicate effectively both written and verbal with senior management to drive key results. 
Define objectives and key results for multiple projects, develop status reports, and provide qualitative and quantitative results analysis.

2+ years of relevant experience in a Supply Chain, Warehousing or Retail Environment

Strong organization, project management skills, and ability to multitask and plan resources

Relentless problem-solving approach with direct knowledge of job-aides and job instructions to define, evaluate, and improve end-to-end processes. 
Technical skills: GooglesSuite, Airtable, Jira, Looker, or relevant project management and analytical tool experience
Structural thinker, with the ability to bring clarity to complex scenarios
Effective collaborator who is able to bring multiple stakeholders together and gain alignment on short-term and long-term operational and strategic decisions

An ability to hit the ground running-a confident, entrepreneurial self-starter
